00023 /* 
00024  * we create a unix domain socket with the name .php_java_bridge in
00025  * the tmpdir
00026  */
00027 #ifndef P_tmpdir
00028 /* xopen, normally defined in stdio.h */
00029 #define P_tmpdir "/tmp"
00030 #endif 
00031 #define SOCKNAME P_tmpdir"/.php_java_bridge""XXXXXX"
00032 /* Linux: pipes created in the shared memory */
00033 #define SOCKNAME_SHM "/dev/shm/.php_java_bridge""XXXXXX"

00059 #define RECV_SIZE 8192 // initial size of the receive buffer
00060 #define MAX_ARGS 100   // max # of method arguments
00061 
00062 /* checks if we use a servlet backend (re-directed or not) */
00063 #define IS_SERVLET_BACKEND(env) (((*env)->servlet_ctx || EXT_GLOBAL (get_servlet_context) (TSRMLS_C)))
00064 
00065 /* checks if the servlet backend uses HTTP, either because we do not
00066    re-direct or because we override re-direct */
00067 #define IS_OVERRIDE_REDIRECT(env) ((((*env)->peer0!=-1) || EXT_GLOBAL (get_servlet_context) (TSRMLS_C)))
00068 
00069 typedef struct proxyenv_ *proxyenv;
00070 struct proxyenv_ {
00071 
00072   /* peer */
00073   int peer, peerr, peer0;       /* peer0 contains peer during override
00074                                    redirect */
00075   short peer_redirected;        /* remains true during override
00076                                    redirect */
00077   struct sockaddr orig_peer_saddr; /* only valid if peer is a servlet, it
00078                                    points to the original peer */
00079 
00080 
00081   /* used by the parser implementation */
00082   unsigned char*s; size_t len; 
00083   ssize_t pos, c; 
00084   unsigned char recv_buf[RECV_SIZE];
00085 
00086   /* the send buffer */
00087   unsigned char*send;
00088   size_t send_len, send_size;
00089 
00090   char *server_name;
00091 
00092   /* local server (not a servlet engine) */
00093   short is_local;
00094 
00095   /* for servlets: re-open connection */
00096   short must_reopen; 
00097 
00098   struct async_ctx {
00099     void (*handle_request)(proxyenv *env);
00100     long nextValue;
00101     void *result;
00102     FILE *peer;
00103     ssize_t (*f_send)(proxyenv*env, const void *buf, size_t len);
00104   } async_ctx;
00105 
00106   /* for servlet engines only */
00107   char *servlet_ctx;
00108   char *servlet_context_string; /* original rinit value from
00109                                    get_servlet_context() */
00110   short backend_has_session_proxy;
00111   
00112   void (*handle)(proxyenv *env);
00113   void (*handle_request)(proxyenv *env);
00114 
00115   void (*writeCreateObjectBegin)(proxyenv *env, char*name, size_t strlen, char createInstance, void *result);
00116   void (*writeCreateObjectEnd)(proxyenv *env);
00117   void (*writeInvokeBegin)(proxyenv *env, long object, char*method, size_t strlen, char property, void* result);
00118   void (*writeInvokeEnd)(proxyenv *env);
00119   void (*writeResultBegin)(proxyenv *env, void* result);
00120   void (*writeResultEnd)(proxyenv *env);
00121   void (*writeString)(proxyenv *env, char*name, size_t strlen);
00122   void (*writeBoolean)(proxyenv *env, short boolean);
00123   void (*writeLong)(proxyenv *env, long l);
00124   void (*writeDouble)(proxyenv *env, double d);
00125   void (*writeObject)(proxyenv *env, long object);
00126   void (*writeException)(proxyenv *env, long object, char*str, size_t len);
00127   void (*writeCompositeBegin_a)(proxyenv *env);
00128   void (*writeCompositeBegin_h)(proxyenv *env);
00129   void (*writeCompositeEnd)(proxyenv *env);
00130   void (*writePairBegin_s)(proxyenv *env, char*key, size_t strlen);
00131   void (*writePairBegin_n)(proxyenv *env, unsigned long key);
00132   void (*writePairBegin)(proxyenv *env);
00133   void (*writePairEnd)(proxyenv *env);
00134   void (*writeUnref)(proxyenv *env, long object);
00135   void (*finish)(proxyenv *env);
00136 
00137   ssize_t (*f_recv)(proxyenv*env, void *buf, size_t len);
00138   ssize_t (*f_recv0)(proxyenv*env, void *buf, size_t len);
00139   ssize_t (*f_send)(proxyenv*env, const void *buf, size_t len);
00140   ssize_t (*f_send0)(proxyenv*env, const void *buf, size_t len);
